TypeScript Roadmap: A Complete Guide [2025 Updated]

Master TypeScript in 2025 with this roadmap covering static typing, interfaces, generics, TS config, React & Node integration, testing, and advanced patterns.

What is TypeScript?

TypeScript is a typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to clean JavaScript and adds optional static typing, interfaces, and compile-time checks.

  • TypeScript Docs

Why TypeScript?

It improves code reliability, catches errors early, enables better editor support, and scales well for larger codebases.

1. Setup & Configuration

Install with `npm install typescript` and initialize `tsconfig.json`.

npx tsc --init

2. Basic Types

Understand primitive types: `string`, `number`, `boolean`, `any`, `unknown`, `void`, `null`, `undefined`, and `never`.

let count: number = 0;
let name: string | null = null;

3. Interfaces & Types

Define object shapes using `interface` or `type` aliases.

interface User { id: number; name: string; }
const u: User = { id: 1, name: 'Alice' };

4. Functions & Generics

Add type-safe function signatures and generic types.

function identity<T>(arg: T): T { return arg; }
const val = identity<string>('hello');

5. Advanced Types

Use union, intersection, enums, mapped types, conditional types, and type guards.

type A = {a:string}; type B = {b:number};
type AB = A & B;
const x: AB = {a:'hi', b:2};

6. Modules & Namespaces

Use ES modules (`import`/`export`) and avoid legacy namespaces.

7. Configuring Build Tools

Integrate TS with Webpack, Rollup, or Vite using `ts-loader` or `esbuild`.

module.exports = {
  module: { rules: [{ test: /.ts$/, use: 'ts-loader' }] }
}

8. Using TS with React

Use `.tsx`, type props & state, and `React.FunctionComponent`.

type Props = { title: string };
const Header: React.FC<Props> = ({ title }) => <h1>{title}</h1>;

9. TS with Node.js

Use TS for backend, compile to CommonJS/ESM, and type Express handlers.

import express, { Request, Response } from 'express';
const app = express();
app.get('/', (req: Request, res: Response) => res.send('Hello TS'));

10. Linting & Formatting

Use `eslint` with TypeScript parser and `prettier` for code style.

11. Testing

Use Jest with `ts-jest` and type-safe tests.

test('sum', () => { expect(1+2).toBe(3); });

12. Declaration Files

Write `.d.ts` for untyped packages and use type augmentation.

13. Tooling & IDE Support

Use VS Code or WebStorm with intellisense and go-to-definition for TS.

14. Migration Strategy

Incrementally migrate JS to TS with `allowJs`, gradually typing.

15. Performance & Compilation

Use `transpileOnly` mode, incremental builds, and `skipLibCheck` for faster compiles.

16. Package Publishing

Publish TS libraries with type definitions to npm (`.d.ts` files).

17. Best Practices

- Use strict mode - Avoid `any` - Prefer interface over type for object shapes - Structure higher-level modules carefully
